synthesis_conditions.washing_method: sequentially with deionized water, EtOH, and Et2O

synthesis_conditions.description: Compound II can be prepared from I by heating I to 100 °C for 1 h in an oven or by exposure of I under an anhydrous environment, e.g., dynamic vacuum or dried nitrogen flow at room temperature.
Compound I was dehydrated by heating to 100 °C for 1 h in an oven, and after removing the sample from the oven, II was treated with anhydrous benzene vapor to give the resultant material III.
